alert.note: Alert for Western Grant; Western Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 13 at 9:58PM EDT until March 14 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches with up to 6 inches along the western facing slopes from Backbone Ridge to the west. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph could result in areas of blowing snow. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett County. In West Virginia, Western Grant and Western Pendleton Counties. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow squalls may impact the Interstate 68, US-219, US-48, and US-40 corridor overnight. Plan for brief but sudden periods of reduced visibility around one-quarter mile along with hazardous travel conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
